intro: Brassica oleracea var. atlantica, commonly known as the Atlantic cabbage, is a variety of the cultivated cabbage species. It is characterized by its compact, dense heads of dark green leaves, similar to other members of the Brassicaceae family. This plant is native to the coastal regions of the Atlantic coast, where it has adapted to salty and windy conditions. It is often used in local cuisines and traditional medicine. Its botanical features include thick, waxy leaves that help retain moisture in its natural habitat.
